issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Negative Test: AWS::EC2::EIP successfully creates when it shouldn't on VPC cloud

comments.body:
I believe this issue occurs when you run a non-vpc instance and attempt to associate a vpc elastic ip address. If so then this is not a valid issue for Eucalyptus as we do not support both VPC and classic networking at the same time. 

What may be happening is that in Eucalyptus you are launching the instance into the default VPC and if you had a default VPC in your AWS account in the region then you may not see that error.
[~hspencer], will you please verify per comment from [~sjones]?
[~hspencer], you'd need to run the instance in the vpc you have created (specify either the subnet or a network interface for the instance resource)

Both templates can be found here:

* https://github.com/eucalyptus/nephoria/blob/master/nephoria/testcases/cloudformation/mvp_templates/vpc/cfn-negativetest-eip-instanceid-customvpc.json
* https://github.com/eucalyptus/nephoria/blob/master/nephoria/testcases/cloudformation/mvp_templates/vpc/cfn-negativetest-eip-instanceid-vpc.json
[~sjones], ah, okay.  It created successfully once I added {{SubnetId}} attribute to {{AWS::EC2::Instance}} resource.
[~hspencer], it was discussed in bug Scrub today that based on your retesting that this is not a bug. Do you concur or still have a reason to believe we are not AWS compliant here?
[~tony], given that we don't offer the same environment as AWS (i.e. support both EC2-Classic and VPC in the same environment), this isn't an AWS compliant bug.

This is a bug, as the error message does occur on EC2 Classic on AWS, but not on accounts that don't have EC2 Classic enabled.  A fix would be to check the vpc id of the instance before doing the eip attachment.

[~ethomas], note that the network mode for this issue is VPC-MIDO. The current cloudformation behaviour in eucalyptus is expected as the instance was created in the default vpc. If you were to delete the default vpc then you would still not see the behaviour described in this issue as then the instance launch would fail.

The template used for this test requires vpc functionality. I don't think we should spend too much time on how it fails on an account that does not support vpc.

If the response from EC2 is not helpful when attempting to associate a vpc domain elastic IP with a non-vpc instance then we should open a separate issue for that.
